meanings.definition: To broadcast (an event) over the internet.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, we webcasted our school play for everyone to watch online.
meanings.sent2: The company webcasted the product launch to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally webcasted its nap to all the viewers on the live stream.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter webcasted joy to all who tuned in to the virtual comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The webcasted music festival made it feel like the whole world was dancing together.

meanings.sent1: Last week, we webcasted the conference and it was a success.
meanings.sent2: She webcasted the interview yesterday for those who missed it.
meanings.sent3: The robot webcasted its malfunction, causing laughter among the viewers.
meanings.sent4: His words webcasted across the room, leaving an impact on everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The webcasted lecture replay helped students review the material at their own pace.
